---
title: "American Idol Seasons"
description:
  Frequency of Judge appearances per season
author: Morgan L
date: September 21, 2025
format: html
---

```{r, echo = FALSE}
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)

seasons <- read_csv("seasons.csv")

# Split judges into individual names
judge_links <- seasons |>
  select(season, judges) |>
  separate_rows(judges, sep = "; ") |>
  mutate(judges = trimws(judges))

# Make a heatmap
ggplot(judge_links, aes(x = factor(season), y = judges)) +
  geom_tile(fill = "pink") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Frequency of Judge appearance per season",
    x = "Season",
    y = "Judge"
  )
```

The American Idol dataset I worked with comes from the TidyTuesday database. 

https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2024/2024-07-23/seasons.csv
